snippet.title: Do you know this man? Police seek public help with armed robbery
snippet.content:
A masked man threatened staff with a knife and demanded cash and codeine pain relief tablets from a Sunshine pharmacy on Friday night. Victoria Police have released CCTV footage of the man, who entered the Devonshire Road store about 9.15pm on Friday.

CCTV: Sunshine chemist armed robbery
Police release footage of the armed man who demanded codeine pain relief tablets from the Devonshire Road store.
Police spokesman Chris Metevelis said the man also removed cash from the till and fled towards Sunshine railway station on Clarke Street. The alleged offender is described as African in appearance, 170cm tall, thick build and wearing dark clothing, including a black balaclava. He was carrying a black backpack. Anyone who recognises the man in the images, or has any information should contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or to submit a report at www.crimestoppersvic.com.au.
